bugs.title: CVE-2016-10169 CVE-2016-10170 CVE-2016-10171 CVE-2016-10172 mingw-wavpack: various flaws [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2016-10169 CVE-2016-10170 CVE-2016-10171 CVE-2016-10172 mingw-wavpack: various flaws [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10169 wavpack: Global buffer overread in read_code / read_words.c

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in wavpack. There is a global buffer overread in read_code / read_words.c. A maliciously crafted file could cause the application to crash.

Upstream bug:

https://sourceforge.net/p/wavpack/mailman/message/35557889/

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/dbry/WavPack/commit/4bc05fc490b66ef2d45b1de26abf1455b486b0dc

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/221

Created mingw-wavpack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-7 [bug 1417860]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1417863]


Created wavpack tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-5 [bug 1417862]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1417861]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10170 wavpack: Heap out of bounds read in WriteCaffHeader / caff.c

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in wavpack. There is a heap out of bounds read in WriteCaffHeader / caff.c. A maliciously crafted file could cause the application to crash.

Upstream bug:

https://sourceforge.net/p/wavpack/mailman/message/35561921/

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/dbry/WavPack/commit/4bc05fc490b66ef2d45b1de26abf1455b486b0dc

References:

http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2017/q1/221

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1417863]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2016-10172 wavpack: Heap out of bounds read in read_new_config_info / open_utils.c

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability was found in wavpack. There is a heap out of bounds read in read_new_config_info / open_utils.c. A maliciously crafted file could cause the application to crash.

Upstream bug:

https://sourceforge.net/p/wavpack/mailman/message/35561951/

Upstream patch:

https://github.com/dbry/WavPack/commit/4bc05fc490b66ef2d45b1de26abf1455b486b0dc

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.
